item.title: The Age of the Essay [Paul Graham]
item.description: The Age of the Essay. Paul Graham. http://www.paulgraham.com/essay.html. Sep 1, 2004. The purpose of an essay is to figure something out. Ergo, you can't begin with a statement. Expressing ideas helps you form them. Writing something that others might read forces you to think well. Writing also helps me code better. When I have a nasty bug, it's easy to try out so many ideas such that you lose track of what you've learned.

item.title: An Introduction to Writing
item.description: You need to develop a broad spectrum of style and then be able to move from one end of the spectrum to the other as occasion demands. You'll develop a basic style but inability to diversify is being like a baller with a drive but no jump shot. Questions to ask: What am I writing about? Who will read what I've written? Why did I write it? I'm writing about topics that I want to know more about.
